ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: vast array of knowledge about contemporary china!
How to critically engage with Chinese political and economic data--we learned how to interpret the Chinese official narrative/strategy in relation to its current circumstances.

the factors of the political economy of China -- from how the government works, the economic histroy of the nation,  the mechanisms through which government interacts with industry, the policy that they direct, and how the policy differs from local to national levels.


Great class!
knowledge about the political economy of China

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: very safe and open environment to discuss

Strengths: Overall my favorite course of the semester! Lectures were well organized, engaging, specifically tied to the weekly readings, and expectations for all assignments were very clear. The final paper assignments (proposal, draft, and presentation) were perfect for helping us get a head-start to the end of the semester and incorporate comments along the way. 

Weaknesses: Honestly cannot think of any. Great course!

Strengths:
prof, format, class community

Weaknesses:
n/a
the professor is very devoted and engaged. He is super helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! took it after rise of china, felt like a deeper dive.

Yes! The class was well organized to cover a variety of topics, but the assignments and paper is very open ended so you have the liberty to explore something that really interests you. Professor Li was excellent--he was engaging, responsive, and provided clear and timely feedback on all assignments.
Best seminar class here at Yale! Enthusiastic professor, intriguing subject, perfectly curated readings, and great class discussions.
